column4: okay, gnomeshell is installed,but attempting to run gives me an error message, unable to open X display
whilst installing it told me to edit some config files, does anyone know these?
how are you trying to run gnome-shell?  "unable to open X display" is suspicious
sudo gnome-shell from a forced cli
oh my
way off, aren't i?
unity will work this way but unity doesn't work.
1) don't use sudo when you don't need to 2) don't use sudo for GUI apps 3) use a DM to select gnome-shell
lightdm, gdm, kdm, etc
desktop manager
so what do i need to enter in the cli?
startx you could try
literally startx?
yes, "startx" as a command
startx prints more errors
do you already have an Xorg session running?
probably
then "startx" won't work until you stop it
i'm getting into the CLI via booting into ubuntu, then cntrl+alt+f6
my spideysense is tingling telling me that's causing issues
ya, "sudo service lightdm" should stop it probably
ya, "sudo service lightdm stop" sorry
i have funky graphics card setup
